Benefit.definition: something that provides an advantage or gain ;specif

1.definition: something that provides an advantage or gainan enhancement of property value, enjoyment of facilities, or increase in general prosperity arising from a public improvement

general benefit.definition: a benefit to the community at large resulting from a public improvement

special benefit.definition: a benefit from a public improvement that directly enhances the value of particular property and is not shared by the community at large
special benefit.note: In proceedings for a partial taking for the purpose of a public improvement, the condemning authority may use a special benefit to the remaining land as a set-off against the landowner's damages for the taking.

2.definition: a right esp. that serves to limit a person's liability

benefit of dis路cus路sion.definition: the right of a surety being sued to compel the suing creditor to sue the principal first

benefit of di路vi路sion.definition: the right of a surety being sued to compel the suing creditor to also sue the cosuretiesthe right of the surety to be liable only for his or her proportionate share of the debt

benefit of inventory.definition: the right of an heir to be held liable for the debts of the estate only to the extent of the assets in the estate
benefit of inventory.note: The heir obtains the benefit of inventory by having a qualified public officer (as a notary public) make an inventory of the assets in the estate within the time period set by statute.

3 a.definition: financial help in time of disability, sickness, old age, or unemployment

sub_terms.b: payment or service provided for under an annuity, pension plan, or insurance policy see also
